In summary, triplet excitations in the dimerized quantum magnet Ba 2CuSi 2O 6Cl 2 were investigated via inelastic neutron scattering experiments. Two modes of the triplet excitations were detected together with a clear energy gap, which is induced by alternation of the interdimer interactions along the a-axis. This result is consistent with the newly determined crystal structure: the lack of a-glide allows interdimer interactions along the a-axis to alternate, while those along the b-axis become uniform.
